name: Input

jtbd.functional: Capture user text input with real-time validation feedback. The foundational form element for data entry.
jtbd.affordance: Bordered rectangle with placeholder text signals 'type here'. Error/success states use color + helper text to communicate validation without requiring the user to submit first.
jtbd.emotional: Reduces form anxiety. Clear validation states and helpful error messages make users confident they're entering data correctly.

anatomy.group: .t-input-group — Vertical flex container grouping label, input, and helper text
anatomy.label: .t-label — Form label with optional required indicator (.t-label--required)
anatomy.input: .t-input — The text input element with full token coverage

state.default: No modifier — neutral border, placeholder visible.

accessibility.ariaDescribedby: Helper text linked via aria-describedby for screen reader context
accessibility.ariaInvalid: Set aria-invalid='true' when in error state
accessibility.ariaRequired: Set aria-required='true' when required (in addition to visual indicator)
accessibility.keyboard: Standard text input keyboard behavior. Tab to focus, type to enter.
accessibility.screenReader: Label announced on focus. Error/helper text announced via aria-describedby.
accessibility.contrast: Border meets 3:1 non-text contrast. Error state uses color + text (not color alone).

knownIssues: No textarea variant — only single-line input
No input masking or formatting (phone, currency) — requires JS
Error focus ring uses hardcoded box-shadow values for danger color
futureConsiderations: Search input variant with clear button
